intro: Euphrasia rostkoviana var. campestris, commonly known as the field eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in spikes. Euphrasia rostkoviana var. campestris is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported eye health benefits.
